Key Match Events: Mehedi Hasan's inadvertent deflection of an Ajdin Hrustić effort into his own net in the first half
Kusini Yengi's second-half header secured the win for Australia
Jordy Bos sent in a pinpoint delivery for Yengi to head in for the second goal in the 62nd minute
Post-Match Reflections: Graham Arnold was critical of the surface at the Bashundhara Kings Arena, calling it 'unacceptable' and 'dangerous'
Arnold expressed relief that his players escaped injury despite the poor pitch conditions

Nestory Irankunda made his international debut and reflected on his performance, stating, 'I could have done better with my performance but I’m really proud to obviously cap for the nation, it’s a dream come true for me'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a pitch that was described as patchy and degraded significantly as the game wore on
Australia dominated possession with 74% by the end of the game but managed just four shots on target
Jordy Bos was highlighted as Australia's best player, demonstrating his potential as one of the best prospects the Socceroos have produced in decades
